document_data.name: Dellys
document_data.mainbody:
'''Dellys''' was a news hawker who worked for the ''[[Baldur's Mouth]] Gazette'' in the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
{{Quote|You looking for a papercut? I told you, you can have a broadsheet when I finish my break.|Dellys}}
document_data.Description: Dellys was a dark-skinned [[human]] boy with brown eyes. He wore a quality leather [[jerkin]] and a hat while selling the [[broadsheet]]s.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, during the [[Absolute crisis]], Dellys could often be found peddling the ''Baldur's Mouth Gazette'' across the street from [[Beehive Goods and Wares]] in the Lower City alongside [[Pharnilla]], with whom Dellys took breaks. When he was interrupted whilst on a break, Dellys claimed to be a member of the Gazetteers' Guild and stated he had rights and whatever business the person had would have to wait.
